text.p: Following are some of the top headlines in leading Italian newspapers.

* Separatist Northern League leader Umbero Bossi repeated that in spite of recent talks on a possible political alliance with centre-right opposition for local elections in Venice his party would not give up its stand on the need for independence for northern Italy. Opposition Freedom Alliance and the Northern League are trying to agree on a common candidate for mayoral election in Venice (all).

* State telecoms group Telecom Italia said in its three-year economic programme that the group was planning a 50 trillion lire turnover and some 35 trillion lire investments by the year 2000 (Sole 24 Ore).
* A preliminary report by the Italian Treasury said fiscal revenues rose to 64,7 billion lire in June, 2.5 percent higher compared with May (Sole 24 Ore).

* Energy group Tamoil reduced petrol and diesel prices by 10 lire per litre following a similar announcement by Agip and IP on Tuesday. Industry minister Pierluigi Bersani said the government would try to monitor prices in the energy sector (all).
** Reuters has not verified these stories and cannot vouch for their accuracy.
